data.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of a ‘slippery slope’ as discussed in this module?

option: A. A slippery slope occurs when you raise concerns but feel you may be retaliated against, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.
B. A slippery slope occurs when you tell one lie and you never retain your standing as an honest and trustworthy person, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.
C. A slippery slope is the idea that if everyone else is doing it, it is easy to rationalize unethical behavior, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.
D. A slippery slope occurs when one small act of dishonesty leads to more and larger acts of dishonesty, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.

response.content: A is incorrect. Tim Donaghy may have feared retaliation but that is not the definition of a slippery slope. A slippery slope occurs when one small act of dishonesty leads to more and larger acts of dishonesty, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.

B is incorrect. It is rare that a single act of dishonesty would result in a complete loss of trust in the workplace. A slippery slope occurs when one small act of dishonesty leads to more and larger acts of dishonesty, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.

C is incorrect. Rationalizing unethical behavior because everyone else is doing it is one of the human tendencies that is described as a fudge factor in this course. A slippery slope occurs when one small act of dishonesty leads to more and larger acts of dishonesty, as was the case for Tim Donaghy.
D is correct. Like in the case of Tim Donaghy, a slippery slope occurs when one small act of dishonesty leads to more and larger acts of dishonesty.
